info.headline: Typhoon Watch issued October 10 at 9:24AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TROPICAL STORM BOLAVEN MOVING NORTHWEST... .NEW INFORMATION... None. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning continues for Rota, Tinian, and Saipan. A Tropical storm warning and a Typhoon Watch continue for Guam. A Flood Watch is in effect for all of Guam and the Northern Marianas. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. .STORM INFORMATION... At 8 AM ChST...the center of Tropical Storm Bolaven (15W) was located near LATITUDE 13.6N...LONGITUDE 146.8E...or about 110 miles east-southeast of Rota, about 125 miles southeast of Tinian and Saipan, and about 135 miles east of Guam radar. Storm motion was northwest at 18 mph. Storm intensity was 70 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... Tropical Storm Bolaven will pass through the Marianas this afternoon. Once damaging winds begin, they will likely continue into early Wednesday morning, peaking this afternoon. Rain-water flooding and coastal inundation will also be a significant threat. The latest forecast track continues to highlight the strongest wind threat to be across Rota, Tinian and Saipan. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 3 PM ChST...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Tropical Storm Warning remains in effect... ...Typhoon Watch remains in effect... ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... ...Probability of tropical storm/hurricane conditions... Tropical storm force winds are expected. This is a steady trend since the last local statement. ...Winds... As Bolaven moves closer, winds will increase, first coming from the north to northwest today, then shifting to west to southwest as Bolaven passes to the north tonight. The latest forecast is for tropical storm force winds from late this afternoon to late this evening, peaking at 30 to 45 mph, gusting to 60 mph. ...Coastal inundation and surf information... Inundation of up to 4 feet is possible as Bolaven passes nearby, especially during high tide around 6 PM this evening. Hazardous surf conditions are expected beginning today and continuing through at least Thursday. The highest surf conditions are expected to begin along north and east, and possibly south facing reefs today as Bolaven nears. Surf will increase and likely become dangerous, exceeding 15 ft, for north and west facing reefs tonight and Wednesday as Bolaven passes to the northwest of the Marianas. ...Inland flooding... A Flood Watch is in effect for the entire area. See latest forecast for latest information. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location...and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Soils are already wet from previous rainfall, so it won`t take much to cause flooding.
info.instruction: Rush to completion all preparations for the protection of life and property. Evacuate if directed to do so by local officials...or if your home is vulnerable to high winds or flooding. Within the next few hours conditions will deteriorate rapidly. For interests at ports...docks...and marinas...complete preparations according to your emergency operations plan for tropical cyclones. If you live on a boat...make final preparations for securing your craft before leaving it. Small craft should remain in port and well secured. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information... please refer to the detailed recommendations from your local emergency management office.
